isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - DISASSEMBLE - REMOVE THE DIFFERENTIAL FROM THE CARRIER

svcproc.title: REMOVE THE DIFFERENTIAL FROM THE CARRIER

note.para: Before you start work on the differential carrier, inspect the hypoid gear set for damage. If the inspection shows no damage, the same gear set can be used again. Measure the backlash of the gear set and make a note of the dimension ( Figure 10). Refer to ADJUST BACKLASH OF RING GEAR.

figure.caption: Figure 10. Measure Backlash of Gear Set

step1.para: Loosen the jam nut * on the thrust screw *.
Remove the thrust screw * and jam nut * from the differential carrier ( Figure 11).

para.ftnote: *Some Rockwell Carriers do not have the parts described.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Remove Thrust Screw and Jam Nut From Differential Carrier

note.para: Some Rockwell carrier models have a thrust block *. The thrust block will fall away from the ring gear inside the carrier when you remove the thrust screw ( Figure 12).

step1.para: Rotate the differential carrier in the repair stand until the ring gear is at the top of the assembly.
Mark one carrier leg and bearing cap for the purpose of correctly matching the parts when you assemble the carrier. A center punch and hammer can be used to mark the parts ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Mark Carrier Leg and Bearing Cap

step1.para: Remove the cotter keys *, pins * or lock plates * that hold the two bearing adjusting rings in position. Use a small drift and hammer to remove pins. Each lock plate is held in position by two capscrews ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Remove Cotter Key and Lock Plate

step1.para: Remove the capscrews and washers that hold the two bearing caps on the carrier. Each cap is held in position by two capscrews and washers ( Figure 15).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Remove Capscrews and Washers Holding Bearing Caps on Carrier

step1.para: Remove the bearing caps and bearing adjusting rings from the carrier ( Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Remove Bearing Caps and Bearing Adjusting Rings

step1.para: Safely lift the main differential and ring gear assembly from the carrier. Put the assembly on a work bench ( Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Lift Main Differential and Ring Gear Assembly From Carrier

step1.para: Remove the thrust block * from inside the carrier.
